title: Airlift could be the Achilles' heel in the US Air Force plan for surviving a fight with China
description: The Air Force has a concept for keeping its aircraft survivable in a war with China. The service's airlift problem could hinder that plan.

title: Hegseth likens strikes on alleged drug boats to post-9/11 war on terror, saying Trump can order use of force ‘as he sees fit’
description: Hegseth dismissed criticism of the strikes, which have killed more than 80 people and now face intense scrutiny over concerns that they violated international law.

title: I saved $3 million but was afraid to spend it when I retired. Here's how I changed my mindset after being frugal for decades.
description: Tactics like having a "war chest" for fun experiences and a "paycheck" helped Scott Scovel feel comfortable spending money after 40 years of saving.

title: I saved $3 million but was afraid to spend it when I retired. Here's how I changed my mindset after being frugal for decades.
description: Tactics like having a "war chest" for fun experiences and a "paycheck" helped Scott Scovel feel comfortable spending money after 40 years of saving.

title: This Game Awards Teaser Just Keeps Getting More And More Puzzling
description: The Game Awards are coming up soon, and now host and organizer Geoff Keighley is hyping the event with some kind of real-world teaser campaign for something people believe is connected to Diablo. Others do not believe it is connected to Diablo. Some think it's for the next God of War game. Still others think it could be for The Elder Scrolls 6. All of these suggestions may be wrong, however.

title: Battlefield 6 Update Adds Winter Offensive And Limited Time Multiplayer Event
description: Battlefield 6's 1.1.3.0 update is bringing the fog of war into winter. As part of the new Winter Offensive, players will be able to access a new version of the Empire State map called Ice Lock Empire State.

title: Shanghai, Ningbo Set Container Records as China Ports Defy Trade Headwinds
description: The two gateways surpassed throughput levels of 90 million TEUs for 2025 with a month to spare despite the country's trade war with the U.S.

title: Russia mocks EU deliberations on frozen assets, says seizure will prompt 'harshest response'
description: Russia said on Thursday that any "illegal action" by the European Union in relation to ​its frozen assets would elicit "the harshest reaction", and that ‌Moscow was already preparing its response.  The European Commission proposed on Wednesday an ‌unprecedented use of frozen Russian assets or international borrowing to raise 90 billion euros ($105 billion) for Ukraine to cover its struggling military and basic services against Russia's war.  The proposal would invoke emergency ⁠powers in order to ‌circumvent any veto from EU countries that are friendly towards Russia, such as Hungary and Slovakia.

title: A US strike on a suspected drug boat has the military in the hot seat. Its own law of war manual explains why.
description: Killing a shipwrecked enemy combatant is a "patent violation" of military law, according to a legal expert and the Pentagon's law of war manual.

title: The former legal analyst for the network believes everyone who gave or followed the alleged “kill everybody” order must be brought to justice.
description: One of Pete Hegseth’s former colleagues at Fox News says it gives him “no pleasure to say” that the defense secretary must be prosecuted for war crimes. Andrew Napolitano, now a senior judicial analyst on the pro-Trump network Newsmax, dismissed the White House’s claim that the U.S. military acted within the law when Hegseth allegedly ordered that everyone aboard a suspected Venezuelan drug boat be killed in the Caribbean in September, including two people who survived the initial airstrike. “I wish the White House would reveal to us the laws on which the president is relying.

title: US lawmakers to force vote on war powers if Trump attacks Venezuela
description: By Patricia Zengerle WASHINGTON, Dec 2 (Reuters) - A group of U.S. senators who have tried repeatedly to rein in President Donald Trump's aggression against Venezuela said on Tuesday they would file a

title: Doodling, drowsiness and a conspicuous misspelling highlight Trump's last Cabinet meeting of 2025
description: With Tuesday's White House Cabinet meeting chugging past the two-hour mark, President Donald Trump 's eyes fluttered and closed.  Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth was lucky enough to speak early, but the title on his nameplate was misspelled.  Trump declared that he didn't want Somalis in the U.S. and Hegseth cited the “ fog of war ” in defending a follow-up strike on an alleged drug-carrying boat in the Caribbean Sea in September.

title: Mass wedding in Gaza celebrates new life after years of war and tragedy
description: Eman Hassan Lawwa was dressed in traditional Palestinian prints and Hikmat Lawwa wore a suit as they walked hand-in-hand past the crumbled buildings of southern Gaza in a line of other couples dressed in exactly the same way.  The 27-year-old Palestinians were among 54 couples to get married Tuesday in a mass wedding in war-ravaged Gaza that represented a rare moment of hope after two years of devastation, death and conflict.  "Despite everything that has happened, we will begin a new life," Hikmat Lawwa said.

title: The defense secretary’s placard had an unfortunate misspelling.
description: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth drew ridicule for a disastrous typo on his namecard during Tuesday’s Cabinet meeting. Hegseth’s placard labeled his role in the administration as the “SSecretary of War” at the meeting, where he doubled down on his department’s deadly boat strikes in the Caribbean and vowed to put “narcoterrorists at the bottom of the ocean.” The typo was immediately mocked by critics, including California Gov. Gavin Newsom, who hinted at its disturbing similarity to the SS, the Nazi Germany paramilitary organization responsible for the genocide of roughly six million Jews during the Holocaust.

title: Arundell wins wing war and Curry sees yellow - Prem talking points
description: Bath flier Henry Arundell's face-off with wing rival Noah Caluori was an intriguing battle as the Prem returned from an autumn lay-off

title: A co-host on the show said Japanese soldiers were “convicted and executed” for killing Americans in the water.
description: Secretary of Defense Pete Hegseth could be in trouble legally over allegedly greenlighting a double-tap on a Venezuelan boat, Morning Joe hosts have claimed. It comes after a Washington Post article cited sources with direct knowledge of the operation who said Hegseth’s “order was to kill everybody.” Former Republican congressman Joe Scarborough claimed the so-called ‘Secretary of War’ could be in a “dangerous” position with the law, if allegations are true.

title: Lawmakers sound alarm over report on Hegseth’s boat strike order — ‘This rises to the level of a war crime if it’s true’
description: The Washington Post reported that Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth issued a verbal order for all crew members to be killed as part of a Sept. 2 attack.

title: Sea drones halt operations at major Russian oil terminal
description: One of Russia's largest oil terminals halted operations on Saturday following an attack by sea drones, hours before Ukrainian negotiators were headed to the United States for talks on ending the war.The Caspian Pipeline Consortium (CPC), a group that includes US oil majors Chevron and ExxonMobil and which owns the terminal, called the strike a "terrorist attack".Ukraine, which did not comment on the incident, has sought to punch back against its neighbour as the war grinds through its fourth year.The attack came as Moscow's forces fired a deadly storm of drones and missiles at Ukraine, killing three people and damaging buildings across Kyiv, according to Ukrainian officials."As a result of a targeted terrorist attack by unmanned boats at 4:06 am Moscow time (0106 GMT) single Mooring Point 2 (SMP-2) sustained significant damage," the CPC said in a statement on Telegram.

title: I toured the only remaining German submarine captured by the US during World War II. Take a closer look.
description: On June 4, 1944, the US Navy captured its first German submarine. Now it's displayed at Chicago's  Griffin Museum of Science and Industry.

title: Full WWE Survivor Series Results & Highlights: Who Survived War Games?
description: On Saturday night, WWE returns to the ESPN app for its latest premium live event, Survivor Series: War Games. The

title: North Korea's Kim stresses Air Force's nuclear war deterrence on its 80th anniversary
If Nuclear War Started Tomorrow, These U.S. Cities Would Vanish First
description: If nuclear war started tomorrow these U.S. Cities would vanish first.

title: ‘A step-change’: tech firms battle for undersea dominance with submarine drones
description:
As navies seek to counter submarines and protect cables, startups and big defence companies fight to lead market
Flying drones used during the Ukraine war have changed land battle tactics for ever. Now the same thing appears to be happening under the sea.
Navies around the world are racing to add autonomous submarines. The UK’s Royal Navy is planning a fleet of underwater uncrewed vehicles (UUVs) which will, for the first time, take a leading role in tracking submarines and protecting undersea cables and pipelines. Australia has committed to spending $1.

title: A Legendary Missing World War II Destroyer Emerged From the Ocean After 82 Years
description: The “Dancing Mouse” faced off against a Japanese convoy and was lost to the sea—until now.

title: World Of Warcraft's Midnight Expansion Launches In March 2026
description:
World of Warcraft: Midnight, the eleventh expansion in the long-running MMO and the second chapter of the Worldsoul Saga, is set to launch on March 2, 2026. Positioned between The War Within (2024) and the future expansion The Last Titan, Midnight marks a major return to one of Azeroth's most iconic settings while pushing the overarching saga toward its cosmic climax. Revealed during this past summer and showcased heavily at Gamescom, the expansion signals a dramatic escalation in the war between Light and Void.
Set in a fully rebuilt and reimagined Quel'Thalas, Midnight centers on a massive Void invasion led by Xal'atath, whose manipulations during The War Within left Azeroth vulnerable to the voidlord Dimensius. The Void now seeks to claim the Sunwell--a source of potent magical energy--and plunge the world into terror.

title: A Short History of the Long War on Drugs in Latin America
description: Greg...

title: The US Air Force just war-gamed how pilots would fight if they lost communications in a high-intensity future war
description: In a future war, pilots may have to continue missions without consistent communications from commanders, forcing them to adapt.

title: Oil Declines With Focus on Ukraine Peace Talks and OPEC+ Meeting
description: Oil fell as investors tracked US-led efforts to end the war in Ukraine, while looking ahead to an OPEC+ gathering this weekend.

title: 'Everything is soaked': Winter rains in Gaza bring new misery for Palestinians
description: DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — Children and families in Gaza scooped muddy water from their tents on Tuesday, trying to protect the few belongings that remain after two years of war.  Winter's heavy rains have left displaced Palestinians splashing in water that reaches their ankles, and blaming both Israel and Hamas for the misery that remains despite a ceasefire.  “All tents were destroyed,” said Assmaa Fayad in Deir al-Balah in central Gaza, whose shelter was damaged in Tuesday’s latest downpour.

title: What to Watch in Commodities as US Pushes Ukraine Peace Deal
description: Fresh efforts to end the war in Ukraine are putting renewed scrutiny on what will happen to the flow of multiple raw materials that have been upended by the near-four-year conflict.

title: Boris Kagarlitsky on the Trump Administration’s 28-Point Plan to End the Ukraine War
description: Boris...

title: Daughter of ex-South African leader Zuma is accused of luring men to fight in Russia-Ukraine war
description: South African police say they are investigating allegations that former President Jacob Zuma 's daughter Duduzile Zuma-Sambudla lured 17 men who are now trapped in Russia into fighting in that country's war with Ukraine without their consent.  According to police spokesperson Athlenda Mathe, an affidavit filed by Zuma-Sambudla's sister Nkosazana Bonganini Zuma-Mncube alleges that Zuma-Sambudla and two other people lured the men by claiming they would receive security training in Russia.

title: US, Ukraine to continue work on 'refined' peace plan to end war with Russia
Alibaba, Meituan Earnings Pressured by Delivery Price War Amid AI Race
description: Alibaba Group Holding Ltd. and Meituan are set to show a continued profit erosion after JD.com Inc. broke up their long-held duopoly in the meal delivery and fast-commerce sectors earlier this year.

title: Ukraine and Russia both to cede plenty in proposed U.S. peace plan
description: STORY: Here are the key points from the U.S. drafted peace plan for ending the war in Ukraine The plan locks in Russia's battlefield gains since February 2022, almost one-fifth of Ukraine.Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy has previously ruled out gifting Moscow any territory.Ukraine would also to have to cede the rest of Donetsk to Russia - an area it currently controls.

title: US, Ukraine and European officials hold talks in Geneva on Trump's plan to end war
Ukraine's president is under growing pressure. Here are 5 things to know
description: The president of Ukraine is facing a confluence of crises testing his ability to lead an increasingly weary nation nearly four years into a devastating full-scale invasion by Russia.  For more than a week, Volodymyr Zelenskyy has struggled to contain the fallout from a $100 million corruption scandal implicating top officials and other associates.  The pressure on Zelenskyy has ratcheted up as the United States pushes a proposal it drew up with Russia that would require major concessions from Ukraine — and seemingly few from Russia — to bring an end to the war.

title: The Xbox 360 Vs PS3 Console War Was A Race To 10 Million Sales, Ex-Xbox Exec Says
description:
The era of console wars seems to be nearing its end, but one of its key players, Peter Moore, who led the charge during the launch of the Xbox 360, is sharing his memories of his time on the gaming frontlines. When it came to pitting the Xbox 360 against the PlayStation 3, Moore says 10 million was the magic number--"You've got this flywheel effect ... of [if] your mate in the school yard's got one, you better get one."
Speaking to Eurogamer, Moore explained that getting the Xbox 360 into the market ahead of the PS3 was key to its strong performance, saying that the first 10 million sales were vital. "I think it was really important to get it out first," Moore said.

title: The U.S. aims to breathe easy amid China’s chokehold on rare earths, but loosening the grip takes years of concerted effort
description: U.S. races to establish rare earths supply chains domestically and abroad in "Cold War 2.0."

title: Western soldiers are turning to Xbox controllers to fight a new kind of drone war. The pilots love them.
description: Operators are using the Xbox controllers to fly interceptor drones, an air defense tool that has been used extensively in Ukraine.

title: I toured the fastest, longest, and most decorated US battleship ever built. Take a look inside the USS New Jersey.
description: The USS New Jersey, an Iowa-class battleship, served in World War II, Korea, Vietnam, Lebanon, and the Persian Gulf. It's now a floating museum.

title: The oldest restaurant in every state
description: Some of the oldest restaurants in America have been open since the late 1600s, while others were the site of key moments during the Revolutionary War.

title: Ukraine firmly rejects any border changes under US peace plan
description: Ukraine's ambassador to the United States has firmly ruled out any border changes in the country in response to a US peace plan to end the war launched by Russia nearly four years ago. "The territorial integrity of Ukraine and the changing of Ukrainian borders is not something which should be put on the table," Olha Stefanishyna said during a roundtable discussion in Washington on Thursday evening.
